rate_source.label: Rate Source
rate_source.comment: You can use the rates you have entered for Magento's Table Rates shipping method or you can choose to enter table rates specific for the PostNL shipping method.

import_export_header.label: You can import and export rates on the website scope. You can change your current scope with the dropdown at the top left of this page.

include_virtual_price.label: Include Virtual Products in Price Calculation

general.label: General Settings
general.comment: Here you can enable or disable the entire extension. This is also where you register your extension for use.

activation_in_progress_header.label: The extension has been partially activated. Fill in the fields below and press the 'finish activation' button below to finish the procedure. Click here to reset the activation procedure.

activated_header.label: The extension has been activated. Click here to be able to activate the extension under a different name.

email.label: Email
email.comment: During activation 2 secure keys will be sent to this email address.

cif.label: Account Settings
cif.comment:
Here you can configure your PostNL account.

In order to use this extension you need to register yourself with PostNL. You will then receive all necessary information in order to configure the extension. If you cannot find the email containing this information, please contact your PostNL account manager.

If you want to test the extension, but don't have any test mode credentials you can use the account credentials found here.

customer_number.label: Customer Number
customer_number.tooltip: If you are a contract customer of PostNL, you will have received an email containing this setting. If you cannot find this email, please contact PostNL support at 058-2333343

customer_code.label: Customer Code
customer_code.comment: Your customer code as supplied by PostNL. Must contain between 3 and 4 letters.
customer_code.tooltip: If you are a contract customer of PostNL, you will have received an email containing this setting. If you cannot find this email, please contact PostNL support at 058-2333343

live_username.label: Live Username
live_username.tooltip: If you are a contract customer of PostNL, you will have received an email containing this setting. If you cannot find this email, please contact PostNL support at 058-2333343

live_password.label: Live Password
live_password.tooltip: If you are a contract customer of PostNL, you will have received an email containing this setting. If you cannot find this email, please contact PostNL support at 058-2333343

collection_location.label: BLS (location) Code
collection_location.comment: The internal code of the nearest PostNL sorting centre. Must contain 6 numbers.
collection_location.tooltip: If you are a contract customer of PostNL, you will have received an email containing this setting. If you cannot find this email, please contact PostNL support at 058-2333343

validate_button.comment: You can use this button to validate your account settings without saving the configuration.
validate_button.tooltip:
This will send a 'test' request to PostNL. If the above fields are not entered correctly, this will result in an error. Please note that the PostNL extension must be active for the validation to succeed.
Please note that the webshop ID and public webshop ID fields will not be validated. Only your CIF credentials will be checked.

global_fields_header.label: These fields are only required if you intend to send products to countries outside the EU.

use_globalpack.label: Use GlobalPack
use_globalpack.comment: GlobalPack is used to ship orders outside the EU. Otherwise you can leave this field disabled.

global_barcode_type.label: Global Barcode Type
global_barcode_type.comment: The current global barcode type as supplied by PostNL. Must contain 2 letters.

global_barcode_range.label: Global Barcode Range
global_barcode_range.comment: Your global barcode range as supplied by PostNL. Must contain 4 digits.

cif_labels_and_confirming.label: Confirming & Label Printing Settings
cif_labels_and_confirming.comment: Here you can specify your confirming and label printing preferences. You can also customize the way our modified shipment and order grids are displayed. Lastly, you can specify whether the extension should automatically send a track & trace email to your customers.

label_size.label: Label size
label_size.comment: This setting only applies to multiple Dutch and EPS labels. GlobalPack labels are always printed as A4. Single Dutch or EPS labels are always printed in A6.

weight_per_parcel.label: Maximum weight per parcel
weight_per_parcel.comment: Determine the maximum weight of each parcel. If a shipment's total weight exceeds this, the shipment will be spread out over multiple parcels.
weight_per_parcel.tooltip: This only applies to Dutch shipments. Each parcel needs to be shipped seperately and will receive it's own shipping label.

weight_unit.label: Weight unit
weight_unit.comment: Select the unit in which you've entered products' weight

shipment_reference_type.label: Shipment reference type
shipment_reference_type.comment: Select what to use as a shipment's reference. This will be printed on the shipping label

custom_shipment_reference.label: Custom reference value
custom_shipment_reference.comment: You can use the following variables: {{var shipment_increment_id}}, {{var order_increment_id}} and {{var store_frontend_name}}. The resulting text may not exceed 28 characters.
custom_shipment_reference.tooltip: You can use this field to for example, add a prefix to the shipment increment ID or to help identify the shipment as coming from your webshop.

grid_header.label: These fields allow you to alter the way the order and shipment grids are displayed.

show_grid_options.label: Show product options in order grid
show_grid_options.comment: This will add a product options field to the create shipments mass action in the order grid. If disabled, default options will be used.
show_grid_options.tooltip: These options will appear in a dropdown field next to the 'create shipments' mass action in the sales > order grid.

show_shipment_type_column.label: Show shipment type column in order grid
show_shipment_type_column.comment: This will add a column to the order grid allowing you to identify whether the order is domestic, EU or global.

shipping_grid_columns.label: Optional Shipment grid columns
shipping_grid_columns.comment: Select which optional columns to show in the shipment grid.
shipping_grid_columns.tooltip: Selecting too many columns may cause the shipment grid to no longer fit on your monitor.

shipping_grid_massaction_default.label: Select a default option for the shipment grid mass action

email_header.label: These fields are used to configure the track & trace email that may be automatically emailed to customers after a shipment has been confirmed.

send_track_and_trace_email.label: Automatically send track & trace email to customer
send_track_and_trace_email.comment: If enabled, a track & trace email will be sent to the customer roughly 20 minutes after a shipment has been confirmed.

track_and_trace_email_template.label: Track & trace email template
track_and_trace_email_template.comment: You can customize the track & trace email in system > transactional emails.

parcelware_export.label: Parcelware Export Settings
parcelware_export.comment: This is where you can configure your Parcelware export.

parcelware_export_disabled_header.label: Parcelware export is disabled. Activate Parcelware export in order to edit these settings. Please note that you can only activate Parcelware export from the global level.

auto_confirm.label: Automatically confirm exported shipments
auto_confirm.comment: If set to yes, shipments that have been exported will be confirmed in Magento.
auto_confirm.tooltip: This does NOT actually confirm the shipment with PostNL. It only updates the status in Magento to prevent you from accidentally confirming it in Magento after you've exported it to Parcelware.

cif_address.label: Address Settings
cif_address.comment: This is where you configure the way the extension handles addresses entered by your customers. If these settings are not configured correctly, PostNL cannot guarantee that all addresses will be printed in the correct format.

use_postcode_check.label: Use postcode check
use_postcode_check.comment: Using this feature will allow customers to only enter their postcode and housenumber, the extension will then automatically validate these fields and enter the correct streetname and city. This only works for Dutch addresses.
use_postcode_check.tooltip: This will affect the layout of the Magento address forms in your checkout and customer account pages. This will also force your store to use atleast 3 address lines. Only default Magento onepage checkout and the Idev OneStepCheckout extension are supported.

postcode_check_in_checkout.label: Use postcode check on checkout page
postcode_check_in_checkout.comment: If enabled the postcode check functionality will be added to your checkout page.
postcode_check_in_checkout.tooltip: Please note that only Magento's onepage checkout and Idev's OneStepCheckout are supported.

postcode_check_in_addressbook.label: Use postcode check in customer's address book
postcode_check_in_addressbook.comment: If enabled the postcode check functionality will be added to the customer's address book.

postcode_check_max_attempts.label: Maximum number of attempts
postcode_check_max_attempts.comment: If a customer exceeds the maximum number of attempts, he/she will be prompted to enter thei address manually. Leave empty to allow an infinite amount of attempts.
postcode_check_max_attempts.tooltip: Beware, if for some reason a valid address cannot be validated and you have no maximum number of attempts defined, the customer may not be able to place their order.

postcode_check_timeout.label: Connection timeout duration
postcode_check_timeout.comment: If the postcode check takes more than this nuber of seconds, the user will be prompted to enter their address manually instead.
postcode_check_timeout.tooltip: If this nuber is set too high, customers may have to wait for a long time before being able to proceed with their order. This could happen in case there is a connection problem to the postcode check servers. Leave this field empty to disable the timeout functionality.

split_street.label: Split street parts
split_street.tooltip: If you do not use split street lines and you wish to ship to outside the EU, there is a strong possibility that PostNL will be unable to properly parse the address. This may result in the shipment being refused or it may even lead to the shipment being delivered at the wrong address!

optional_street_fields_header.label: The following fields are optional and should remain empty, unless you specifically use these fields in your checkout configuration.

doorcode_field.label: Doorcode field
doorcode_field.tooltip: Doorcodes are often used in foreign addresses such as those used in France and Singapore.

cif_sender_address.label: Sender Address
cif_sender_address.comment: This is where you enter your address. This is required for the extension to work.

cif_return_address.label: Return Address
cif_return_address.comment: You may specify a separate return address for shipments that could not be delivered. If you do not wish to specify a separate return address, your sender address will be used.

use_sender_address.label: Use the sender address as the return adress

cif_product_options.label: Product Options
cif_product_options.comment: Here you can specify which PostNL product options you have a contract for. Also you can specify the PostNL product options that will be used by the extension. You can always override the 'default option' settings by manually creating shipments. Please note that if you select a product option which is not covered by your PostNL contract it will result in an error.

supported_product_options.label: Select supported option
supported_product_options.comment: Only the selected options will be available.
supported_product_options.tooltip: If you are unsure which options to select, ask your PostNL account manager.

default_product_option.label: Default shipping option
default_product_option.comment: This setting may be overwritten by manualy creating shipments. This option is only applicable to domestic shipments.

use_alternative_default.label: Use an alternative default option
use_alternative_default.comment: Enable this to use an alternative default option when a shipment's total value exceeds a certain amount.

alternative_default_max_amount.label: Maximum amount
alternative_default_max_amount.comment: The alternative default option will be used when the shipment's total amount exceeds this value.

alternative_default_option.label: Alternative default shipping option
alternative_default_option.comment: This option will be used as default when the shipment's total value exceeds the given amount.

default_evening_product_option.label: Default evening delivery shipping option
default_evening_product_option.comment: This setting may be overwritten by manualy creating shipments. This option is only applicable to domestic evening delivery shipments.

default_pakjegemak_product_option.label: Default 'deliver at the Post Office' option
default_pakjegemak_product_option.comment: This setting can be overwritten by manually creating shipments. This option is only applicable to Post Office shipments.

default_pge_product_option.label: Default early post office pickup option
default_pge_product_option.comment: This setting can be overwritten by manually creating shipments. This option is only applicable to early pickup Post Office shipments.

groups.cif_globalpack_settings:
translate="label comment" module="postnl"> GlobalPack Settings Here you can specify the way GlobalPack shipments are handled. This is very important if you want to ship products to outside the EU. Otherwise you can safely ignore these settings. postnl_adminhtml/system_config_form_fieldset 1200 1 1 0
You have not enabled GlobalPack. Please enable GlobalPack under 'Account Settings' in order to configure your GlobalPack preferences. adminhtml/system_config_form_field_heading 10 1 1 1
cif 0
Customs license number If you do not own a customs license, leave this field empty. text 20 1 1 0
cif 1
Customs certificate number If you do not own a customs certificate, leave this field empty. text 30 1 1 0
cif 1
Default shipment type Please select the default GlobalPack shipment type. You can also specify this manually when creating GlobalPack shipments. select postnl_core/system_config_source_globalpackShipmentType 40 1 1 0
cif 1
The following fields are used to determine several product attributes which are required for international shipping. adminhtml/system_config_form_field_heading 50 1 0 0
cif 1
Use HS Tariff Enable this field to specify a product attribute to use as the product's HS tariff. The HS tariff value is a number used to identify the type of product that is shipped. In general this is only required for larger export volumes. If you disable this setting the value '000000' will be used. Please contact PostNL for more information. select postnl/system_config_source_yesno 60 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1
HS Tariff attribute The product attribute used to determine the product's HS tariff. We recommend you make the chosen attribute mandatory. However, should the attribute you selected be empty for a certain product, the label will note '000000' instead. select postnl_core/system_config_source_attributes 70 1 1 0
cif 1
1
validate-select
Customs value attribute The product attribute used to determine product's customs value. select postnl_core/system_config_source_attributes 80 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1
Country of origin attribute The product attribute used to determine the product's country of origin. select postnl_core/system_config_source_attributes 90 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1
Product description attribyte The product attribute used to supply the product's customs description. select postnl_core/system_config_source_attributes 100 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1
The following fields determine which products are displayed on international shipping labels and how. adminhtml/system_config_form_field_heading 110 1 0 0
cif 1
Product sorting attribute Global shipping labels can only contain 5 products. This attribute will determine how these are sorted so that only the top 5 will be printed. Only the first 5 products are displayed. All other products will NOT be shown on the shipping label or customs declaration. select postnl_core/system_config_source_attributes 120 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1
Product sorting direction select postnl_core/system_config_source_direction 130 1 1 0 validate-select
cif 1

delivery_options.label: PostNL Delivery Options & MijnPakket login
delivery_options.comment:
Here you can configure your PostNL delivery options.
With PostNL delivery options, your customers can choose where and when they want their order delivered. They may choose a date and timeframe for their delivery. Also they can choose to have their order delivered to a nearby post office. New features include the 'evening' delivery option and the option to choose an 'early delivery' post office location. MijnPakket login gives your customers the option to quickly fill in their preferred billing and shipping address by logging in with their PostNL MijnPakket account.

theme.label: Delivery options theme
theme.comment: You can view an example of the different themes here.

mijnpakket_login_active.label: Enable MijnPakket login
mijnpakket_login_active.comment: MijnPakket login will only be available to customers who have a MijnPakket account. This will be automatically detected.

business_rules_header.label: You can disable PostNL delivery options in case the order has products that are not in stock or if the order weighs less than 2 kg.

show_options_for_letter.label: Enable PostNL delivery options for orders under 2 kg
show_options_for_letter.comment: The 2kg limit will be based on the product's weight and the weight unit you selected under the 'Confirm and label printing settings' group.

show_options_for_backorders.label: Enable PostNL delivery options for orders containing out of stock products
show_options_for_backorders.tooltip: Customers can select a specific date and time when they want their shipment delivered when they use PostNL delivery options. If they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock it's possible that you won't be able to guarantee that the item will be delieverd on the chosen date and time. If this setting is disabled customers will not be able to use PostNL delivery options if they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock, thereby preventing this situation.

duration_header.label:
PostNL delivery options determine the possible delivery dates based on a few settings. It is important that you configure these as accurately as you can. You should try to be conservative with these settings. If you cannot transfer a shipment to PostNL on time each day, customers may not receive their order on the requested date.
You can interpret these settings as "If ordered by {cut-off time}, the order will be delivered in {shipping duration} days".

shipping_duration.label: Shipping duration
shipping_duration.comment: The number of days shipping will take after a customer finishes their order.

cutoff_time.label: Order cut-off time
cutoff_time.comment: When an order is placed after this time, another day will be added to the shipping duration.

delivery_days_number.label: Maximum number of delivery days
delivery_days_number.comment: This determines how many days into the future the customer can choose to have their order delivered.
delivery_days_number.tooltip: This value will be added to the earliest possible delivery date. Timeframes will be displayed for all options between the first possible delivery date and this number of days after that.

shipping_duration_header.label: PostNL delivery options allows your customers to choose their delivery date and timeframe, or choose to have their order delivered to a post office, early delivery post office or parcel dispenser. Each of these options can be individually enabled and disabled. In the case of evening- and early delivery, you may charge an additional fee.

enable_timeframes.label: Enable timeframes
enable_timeframes.comment: Timeframes allow customers to specify on which date and at which time they want their order delivered.

enable_evening_timeframes.label: Enable evening delivery
enable_evening_timeframes.comment: Whether or not customers may pick an evening timeframe.
enable_evening_timeframes.tooltip: Evening timeframes may not be available in all areas. The PostNL extension will automatically determine whether or not evening delivery is available for a specific area.

evening_timeframe_fee.label: Evening timeframe fee
evening_timeframe_fee.comment: Additional costs for evening timeframes in the store's base currency. This fee will be added to the shipping costs.
evening_timeframe_fee.tooltip: This value must be between 0.00 and 2.00 EUR incl. VAT. Leave this field empty to charge no extra fee for evening timeframes.

enable_pakjegemak.label: Enable post office locations
enable_pakjegemak.comment: Whether or not customers may choose to have their order delivered to a nearby post office.

enable_pakjegemak_express.label: Enable early delivery locations
enable_pakjegemak_express.comment: Whether or not customers may choose an 'early delivery' location.
enable_pakjegemak_express.tooltip: Not all post offces may support early delivery. You will not be able to use Premium Sorting or Sunday Sorting for these shipments.

pakjegemak_express_fee.label: Early delivery fee
pakjegemak_express_fee.comment: Additional costs for early delivery locations in the store's base currency. This fee will be added to the shipping costs.
pakjegemak_express_fee.tooltip: This value must be between 0.00 and 2.00 EUR incl. VAT. Leave this field empty to charge no extra fee for early delivery locations.

enable_pakketautomaat_locations.label: Enable package dispenser locations
enable_pakketautomaat_locations.comment: Whether or not customers may choose to have their order delivered to a parcel dispenser.
enable_pakketautomaat_locations.tooltip: Parcel dispensers are available at certain NS train stations across the Netherlands. Shipments to parcel dispensers must have minimum dimensions of 38x26.5x3.2cm and maximum dimensions of 41x38x64cm.

allow_streetview.label: Allow Google Streetview
allow_streetview.comment: If enabled, users may use Google Streetview when choosing a post office location.

mijnpakket_notification_header.label: You may choose to show a message to customers after they place their order about MijnPakket. This message will inform customers about the advantages of MijnPakket. Customers who have a MijnPakket account can use this to quickly log in to your webshop, thus reducing the amount of time it takes to complete an order.

mijnpakket_notification.label: Show MijnPakket notification on the order success page
mijnpakket_notification.comment: This will cause a notification to be shown to customers after they have placed their order. The message may either inform the customer about MijnPakket accounts or the MijnPakket app.

show_create_mijnpakket_account_link.label: Show create MijnPakket account link
show_create_mijnpakket_account_link.comment: If enabled, customers who do not yet have a MijnPakket account will be shown a link through which they can create a MijnPakket account without having to fully fill in the registration form.

show_mijnpakket_app_link.label: Show MijnPakket app link
show_mijnpakket_app_link.comment: If enabled, customers who already have a MijnPakket account will be informed about the PostNL MijnPakket app with which they can easily track their order.

checkout.label: PostNL Checkout Settings
checkout.comment:
Here you can enable or disable PostNL Checkout as well as completely customize all of it's facets.

By using PostNL Checkout you can offer your customers the option to easily choose their desired delivery date. They will be able to choose when and where they want their order delivered. They may choose to have the order delivered to their home (on a specific day at a specific time) or to have it delivered to their nearest post office.

PostNL Checkout is a free service, however you do need to register yourself with PostNL. You will then receive all necessary information in order to configure this feature.

show_exclusively_for_mijnpakket_users.label: Show PostNL Checkout exclusively to MijnPakket users
show_exclusively_for_mijnpakket_users.comment: If enabled, PostNL Checkout will only be available to users who already have a Mijnpakket account.
show_exclusively_for_mijnpakket_users.tooltip: This option is only available if delivery options are enabled.

checkout_button_header.label: Here you can customize when and how the PostNL Checkout button is displayed.

instruction_cms_page.label: Instruction page
instruction_cms_page.comment: Select a page containing instructions on how to use PostNL Checkout. A link to this page will be shown underneath the PostNL Checkout button to aid customers. Select 'none' to hide this link.

show_checkout_for_letter.label: Enable PostNL Checkout for orders under 2 kg
show_checkout_for_letter.comment: The 2kg limit will be based on the product's weight and the weight unit you selected under the 'Confirm and label printing settings' group.

show_checkout_for_backorders.label: Enable PostNL Checkout for orders containing out of stock products
show_checkout_for_backorders.tooltip: Customers can select a specific date and time when they want their shipment delivered when they use PostNL Checkout. If they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock it's possible that you won't be able to guarantee that the item will be delieverd on the chosen date and time. If this setting is disabled customers will not be able to use PostNL Checkout if they are attempting to order an item that is not in stock, thereby preventing this situation.

checkout_customization_header.label: Here you can customaize the way PostNL Checkout behaves in your webshop.

show_summary_page.label: Show order summary page
show_summary_page.comment: Whether or not to show the customer a final order summary page before finalizing the order.

newsletter_subscription.label: Newsletter subscription
newsletter_subscription.comment: Whether or not PostNL Checkout will offer the customer the ability to subscribe to your newsletter.
newsletter_subscription.tooltip: Customers who use this feature will subscribe to your webshop's newsletter, not PostNL's newsletter. Please note that 3rd party extensions that alter the Magento newsletter functionality may conflict with this feature.

remark.label: Remark
remark.comment: Whether or not the customer can leave a remark.

use_mobile.label: Use mobile phonenumber
use_mobile.comment: Whether or not the customer's mobile phonenumber will be returned by PostNL if available.
use_mobile.tooltip: The mobile phonenumber will be saved as the customer's regular phonenumber when used.

use_dob.label: Use date of birth
use_dob.comment: Whether or not the customer's date of birth will be returned by PostNL if available.

allow_retail_location.label: Allow post office locations
allow_retail_location.comment: Whether or not the customer may choose a retail location as their delivery address.

allow_foreign_address.label: Allow foreign addresses
allow_foreign_address.comment: Whether or not the customer may choose a foreign address as their shipping address.
allow_foreign_address.tooltip: All addresses outside of the Netherlands are considered 'foreign'. Addresses outside the EU are not possible regardless of this setting.

allow_price_overview.label: Allow price overview
allow_price_overview.comment: Whether or not the user will see a price overview in PostNL Checkout
allow_price_overview.tooltip: The price overview will contain the order's subtotal and shipping costs only.

agree_conditions.label: Agree conditions
agree_conditions.comment: Whether or not the customer must agree to the terms and conditions before being allowed to proceed.
agree_conditions.tooltip: You can enter a URL where the customer can find your terms and conditions in your PostNL Checkout account at http://checkout.postnl.nl

checkout_urls_header.label: These URLs allow the customer to contact you. They will be shown on the user's MijnPakket page.

contact_url.label: Contact URL
contact_url.comment: URL of a page where customers can find contact information for your webshop. Leave empty to disable this feature.

service_url.label: Service URL
service_url.comment: URL of a page where customers can find information regarding the webshop's customer service department. Leave empty to disable this feature.

checkout_payment_methods.label: PostNL Checkout Payment Settings
checkout_payment_methods.comment: This is where you specify which payment options will be presented to your customers in PostNL Checkout. At least one of these must be activated for PostNL Checkout to work.

postnl_checkout_inactive_header.label: PostNL Checkout is disabled. please enable PostNL Checkout in order to configure these settings.

ideal_option_field.label: iDeal Bank Field
ideal_option_field.comment: Enter the field name used by the selected payment method for the 'bank' field.

creditcard_option_field.label: Creditcard card type field
creditcard_option_field.comment: Enter the field name used by the selected payment method for the 'creditcard type' field.

advanced.label: Advanced Settings
advanced.comment: These settings are intended for advanced users only! If you're not 100% sure what you're doing, please do not touch these settings.

debug_mode.label: Debug mode
debug_mode.comment: If enabled, debug logs will be created in the var/logs/TIG_PostNL/ directory.
debug_mode.tooltip: Full logging will log various debugging messages as well as errors. N.B.: these log files may become very large in a short amount of time.

infinite_label_printing.label: Allow infinite label printing
infinite_label_printing.comment: By default a maximum of 200 labels can be printed at once. Enable this to remove this limitation. Beware: enabling this may lead to server instability.

max_parcel_count.label: Maximum number of parcels per shipment
max_parcel_count.comment:
Leave empty to allow an infinite amount of parcels per shipment.
If this value is empty or exceeds 200, you need to set 'Allow infinite label printing' to yes in order to be able to print the shipment's labels.

max_temp_file_storage_time.label: Maximum temporary file storage time
max_temp_file_storage_time.comment: In seconds. After this time, temporary files will be deleted. Only increase this if you use custom functionality to create a very large amount of labels at once.

send_statistics.label: Send extension usage statistics to PostNL
send_statistics.comment: In order to continuously improve the PostNL extension, the extension sends usage statistics to a secure PostNL server.

receive_updates.label: Receive notifications from PostNL regarding updates and promotions
receive_updates.comment: PostNL may periodically send important updates regarding new versions of the PostNL extension or important security updates in the same manner as Magento. Disable this setting to no longer ecieve these notifications.

show_error_details_in_frontend.label: Show error details in the frontend
show_error_details_in_frontend.comment: If set to 'yes', error details will be shown in the frontend when an error occurs. Error details include the error code as well as a link to the TiG knowledgebase article concerning the error. This is useful for debugging purposes, but should be disabled in a production environment.

cif_versions_header.label: The following fields determine the CIF version used by each service. Tampering with these settings may result in unexpected behaviour or it may disable the extension altogether.

cif_versions_infobox.comment: ONLY CHANGE THESE SETTINGS WITH DIRECT INSTRUCTION FROM POSTNL OR TOTAL INTERNET GROUP
